reference.shortdesc: The subjectdef element defines a subject (also known as a controlled value) within a subject scheme. The keys attribute specified on the subjectdef element assigns a key to the subject. A subject with a key can be addressed using a keyref attribute.

section.p: The subjectdef also can use a navtitle element to supply a label for the subject or the href attribute to reference a topic that captures the consensus definition for the subject.

As with normal topicref processing, when the subjectdef element specifies a navtitle and refers to a topic, processors should use the actual topic title in place of the navtitle. To use the navtitle as a subject label, set the locktitle attribute on the subjectdef element to "yes".
